intro: Zygia obolingoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, often with contrasting markings. Its leaves are typically velvety and heart-shaped, adding to its ornamental appeal. Zygia obolingoides is widely cultivated as a houseplant due to its ability to thrive in indoor conditions with proper care.
